overview.author: Darby Van Uitert
overview.summary: Merge two adjacent axes into one. A more general version of unu axdelete. The underlying linear ordering of the samples is unchanged, and the information about the other axes is shifted downwards as needed.

description.p: Merge two adjacent axes into one. A more general version of unu axdelete. The underlying linear ordering of the samples is unchanged, and the information about the other axes is shifted downwards as needed.

Axis: One or more integers separated by white space. Each axis index identified is the lower of the pair of axes that will be merged. Saying -a 2 means to merge axis 2 and axis 3 into axis 2. If multiple merges are to be done, the indices listed here are for the axes prior to any merging.
